div.head: Report:
div.p: We brought several samples of La 2 Co 1.7 preselected with help of X-ray rotation photographs. At the beginning of our experiment we collected several images for each of them in order to start the measurement with the best one.

Then we performed three data collections at λ=0.79973Å, each of them for 8 hours. The first data set at the detector distance 320mm and exposition time ~20s was collected in order to get the best separation of satellite reflections for the q-vector refinement. The second data set with the detector distance 110mm and exposition time ~20s was used for satellite intensities with larger resolution. The last data set with the detector distance 110mm was measured with the smalest possible dose to get the main reflections without overflows. However, some of them were still overflown because we couldn't go with dose below 1. This last data set was measured with 2 oscillations and later we found that some images in random φ values were multiply measured at the same angle, but the information in their header corresponded to successive angles. We repaired these images with binary editor.

The most important goal of the synchrotron measurement was discovering of diffuse scattering planes in our sdample, which were not visible in the X-ray experiment. The interpretation of results is under developement.
